attributes.action: A Ban on the direct charges to consumers for homes supplied gas by an Independent Gas Transporter
attributes.additional_details:
Many new homes are now supplied by IGTs as they will lay the pipes from the central supply to the new homes at a cut price to home builders, thus cutting costs the the builder and creating a revenue stream to the IGTs. However the consumer  then has to pay in general £45pa to the energy supplier. Why is this charge sent directly to the consumer?

Just simply which street in a town a person chooses to live on should not subject them to this charge, and if this is the case then a clear warning should be given to each person who subsequently buys the house. If the ideal scenario listed below is not implemented then clear warnings must be placed before a supplier can tempt consumers into contracts rather than simply hiding behind three lines in their t & c's.

If we are to utilise the IGTs in such a way, the charges must be absorbed into the advertised prices of the energy companies.
